{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.07876v1", "title": "Quintessence models in the late Universe", "summary": "Scalar-tensor theories have shown great potential in inducing tailored
modifications compared to cosmic evolution in the $\Lambda$CDM model. We
reconsider quintessence models in this work in the context of three driving
potentials. We center the action of these models in the late Universe which
leaves early $\Lambda$CDM cosmology unchanged. The effects show the potential
of producing a faster expanding cosmology with a high Hubble constant. The
models are constrained using the cosmic chronometer data, Pantheon plus, and
transversal baryonic acoustic oscillation data.", "main_category": "gr-qc", "categories": "gr-qc", "published": "2025-04-10T15:51:18Z"}
